Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.

Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
3.2 TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT: Either party may terminate this Agreement, without any cancellation charge, for a material breach of the Agreement by the other party or if the other party becomes insolvent or files or has filed against it a petition in bankruptcy ("Cause"), to the extent permitted by law.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
Such termination will be effective at the end of a thirty (30) day written notice period if the Cause remains uncured.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
Either party may terminate this Agreement without Cause when there are no outstanding SOWs.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
3.3 TERMINATION OF A SOW OR WA: Buyer may terminate a SOW with Cause effective immediately or without Cause on 60 days written notice.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's written direction, Supplier will immediately: (i) cease work; (ii) prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Products and Services; (iii) deliver to Buyer Products satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon Prices in the relevant SOW; and (iv) deliver upon request any work in process.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
In the event Buyer terminates without Cause, Buyer will compensate Supplier for the actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Supplier for work in process up to and including the date of termination, provided Supplier uses reasonable efforts to mitigate Buyer's liability under this SubSection by, among other actions, returning to its suppliers, selling to others, or otherwise using the canceled Products (including raw materials or works in process) and provided such expenses do not exceed the Prices.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.

Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
If such a claim is or is likely to be made, Supplier will, at its option: (i) obtain for Buyer the right to continue to use and sell the Products and Services consistent with this Agreement; (ii) modify the Products and Services so they are noninfringing and in compliance with this Agreement; or (iii) replace the Products and Services with noninfringing ones that comply with this Agreement.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
In the event that none of the options in the preceding sentence are commercially practical, at Buyer's request, Supplier shall accept the cancellation of infringing Services and/or the return of infringing Products, and refund to Buyer the amounts paid in respect of such infringing Services and/or infringing Products.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
9.3 EXCEPTIONS TO INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party to the extent such claims arise as a result of: (i) Buyer's combination of Products or Services with products or services not authorized by Supplier or approved for use with the Products; (ii) Supplier's implementation of a Buyer originated design; or (iii) Buyer's unauthorized modification of the Products.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for any claim under this Section 9 unless Buyer has promptly notified Supplier of such claim, has provided Supplier with reasonable assistance in defending any such claim and has allowed Supplier to have sole control over the defense and settlement, if applicable, of any such claim.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer shall have the right, at Buyer's expense, to retain counsel and assist in the defense of any such claim.
Supplier will not make any changes to the form, fit or function of the Products without Buyer's prior written consent, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably.

Supplier will maintain the capability to supply agreed upon Products, including parts of Products, for a period of months after withdrawal of such Products as specified in the relevant SOW.

Supplier will maintain the capability to supply agreed upon Products, including parts of Products, for a period of months after withdrawal of such Products as specified in the relevant SOW.

Supplier will maintain the capability to supply agreed upon Products, including parts of Products, for a period of months after withdrawal of such Products as specified in the relevant SOW.

6.0 WARRANTIES 6.1 ONGOING WARRANTIES: Supplier makes the following ongoing representations and warranties: (i) it has the right to enter into this Agreement and its performance of this Agreement will not violate the terms of any contract, obligation, law, regulation or ordinance to which it is or becomes subject; (ii) to the best of Supplier's knowledge, no claim, lien, or action exists or is threatened against Supplier that would interfere with Buyer's use or sale of the Products; (iii) Products are free from defects in design (except for written designs provided by Buyer unless such designs are based entirely on Supplier's specifications), material and workmanship and will conform to the warranties and specifications in this Agreement for the time period from the date of shipment as specified in the relevant SOW; (iv) Products are safe for any use consistent with and will comply with the warranties and specifications in this Agreement; (v) Products and Services are Year 2000 ready such that they are capable of correctly processing, providing, receiving and displaying date data, as well as exchanging accurate date data with all products with which the Products are intended to be used as set forth in the accompanying documentation, within and between the twentieth and twentyfirst centuries, provided that all other products (e.g., hardware, software and firmware) used in combination with the Products properly exchange date data with the * Certain information on this page has been omitted and filed separately with the Commission.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
Supplier will promptly notify Buyer in writing should there be any failure to adhere to the representations and warranties as stated herein.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
THE WARRANTIES IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS AND CONDITIONS, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING THOSE WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OR CONDITIONS OF MERCHANTABILITY, NONINFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY RIGHTS OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR USE.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
6.2 WARRANTY REDEMPTION: If Products or Services do not comply with the warranties in this Agreement, Supplier will repair or replace Products (at the mutually agreed to level) or reperform Services, or credit or refund the thencurrent Price of Products or Services, such remedy at Supplier's discretion.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
For such Products, Supplier will issue to Buyer a Return Material Authorization ("RMA") within two (2) business days of Buyer's written notice.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
Buyer may return Products which do not conform to the warranties in this Agreement from any Buyer location to the nearest authorized Supplier location at cost of Supplier and Supplier will, at cost of Supplier, return any repaired or replaced Product in a timely manner.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.

6.4 EPIDEMIC DEFECTS: Supplier will, at Buyer's discretion, repair or replace, or provide a credit or refund (at the thencurrent Prices) for Products which have the same or similar defect at a rate as specified in the relevant SOW ("Epidemic Defect Rate"), after verification of such Epidemic Defect Rate by Supplier, or where a safety defect is found.

Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
If such a claim is or is likely to be made, Supplier will, at its option: (i) obtain for Buyer the right to continue to use and sell the Products and Services consistent with this Agreement; (ii) modify the Products and Services so they are noninfringing and in compliance with this Agreement; or (iii) replace the Products and Services with noninfringing ones that comply with this Agreement.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.

9.3 EXCEPTIONS TO INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party to the extent such claims arise as a result of: (i) Buyer's combination of Products or Services with products or services not authorized by Supplier or approved for use with the Products; (ii) Supplier's implementation of a Buyer originated design; or (iii) Buyer's unauthorized modification of the Products.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for any claim under this Section 9 unless Buyer has promptly notified Supplier of such claim, has provided Supplier with reasonable assistance in defending any such claim and has allowed Supplier to have sole control over the defense and settlement, if applicable, of any such claim.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer shall have the right, at Buyer's expense, to retain counsel and assist in the defense of any such claim.
Supplier will notify Buyer of its intent to withdraw any Product and will continue to deliver such withdrawn Products for the periods as specified in the relevant SOW.

3.3 TERMINATION OF A SOW OR WA: Buyer may terminate a SOW with Cause effective immediately or without Cause on 60 days written notice.

Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's written direction, Supplier will immediately: (i) cease work; (ii) prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Products and Services; (iii) deliver to Buyer Products satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon Prices in the relevant SOW; and (iv) deliver upon request any work in process.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
In the event Buyer terminates without Cause, Buyer will compensate Supplier for the actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Supplier for work in process up to and including the date of termination, provided Supplier uses reasonable efforts to mitigate Buyer's liability under this SubSection by, among other actions, returning to its suppliers, selling to others, or otherwise using the canceled Products (including raw materials or works in process) and provided such expenses do not exceed the Prices.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.

Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.

Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
9.2 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will defend, hold harmless and indemnify, including attorney's fees, Buyer and Buyer Personnel from claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
If such a claim is or is likely to be made, Supplier will, at its option: (i) obtain for Buyer the right to continue to use and sell the Products and Services consistent with this Agreement; (ii) modify the Products and Services so they are noninfringing and in compliance with this Agreement; or (iii) replace the Products and Services with noninfringing ones that comply with this Agreement.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
In the event that none of the options in the preceding sentence are commercially practical, at Buyer's request, Supplier shall accept the cancellation of infringing Services and/or the return of infringing Products, and refund to Buyer the amounts paid in respect of such infringing Services and/or infringing Products.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
9.3 EXCEPTIONS TO INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party to the extent such claims arise as a result of: (i) Buyer's combination of Products or Services with products or services not authorized by Supplier or approved for use with the Products; (ii) Supplier's implementation of a Buyer originated design; or (iii) Buyer's unauthorized modification of the Products.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for any claim under this Section 9 unless Buyer has promptly notified Supplier of such claim, has provided Supplier with reasonable assistance in defending any such claim and has allowed Supplier to have sole control over the defense and settlement, if applicable, of any such claim.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer shall have the right, at Buyer's expense, to retain counsel and assist in the defense of any such claim.
Supplier shall process WAs issued by Buyer and shall accept all WAs in Accordance with this Goods Agreement and the applicable SOW.

3.2 TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT: Either party may terminate this Agreement, without any cancellation charge, for a material breach of the Agreement by the other party or if the other party becomes insolvent or files or has filed against it a petition in bankruptcy ("Cause"), to the extent permitted by law.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Such termination will be effective at the end of a thirty (30) day written notice period if the Cause remains uncured.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Either party may terminate this Agreement without Cause when there are no outstanding SOWs.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
3.3 TERMINATION OF A SOW OR WA: Buyer may terminate a SOW with Cause effective immediately or without Cause on 60 days written notice.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's written direction, Supplier will immediately: (i) cease work; (ii) prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Products and Services; (iii) deliver to Buyer Products satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon Prices in the relevant SOW; and (iv) deliver upon request any work in process.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
In the event Buyer terminates without Cause, Buyer will compensate Supplier for the actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Supplier for work in process up to and including the date of termination, provided Supplier uses reasonable efforts to mitigate Buyer's liability under this SubSection by, among other actions, returning to its suppliers, selling to others, or otherwise using the canceled Products (including raw materials or works in process) and provided such expenses do not exceed the Prices.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.

In the event that none of the options in the preceding sentence are commercially practical, at Buyer's request, Supplier shall accept the cancellation of infringing Services and/or the return of infringing Products, and refund to Buyer the amounts paid in respect of such infringing Services and/or infringing Products.

9.3 EXCEPTIONS TO INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party to the extent such claims arise as a result of: (i) Buyer's combination of Products or Services with products or services not authorized by Supplier or approved for use with the Products; (ii) Supplier's implementation of a Buyer originated design; or (iii) Buyer's unauthorized modification of the Products.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for any claim under this Section 9 unless Buyer has promptly notified Supplier of such claim, has provided Supplier with reasonable assistance in defending any such claim and has allowed Supplier to have sole control over the defense and settlement, if applicable, of any such claim.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer shall have the right, at Buyer's expense, to retain counsel and assist in the defense of any such claim.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 10.0 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY: 10.1 LIMITATION: Except for liability under the Section entitled Indemnification and the SubSection entitled Epidemic Defects, in no event will either party be liable to the other for any lost revenues, lost profits, incidental, indirect, consequential, special or punitive damages, whether or not such party was informed of the possibility of such damages.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
10.2 LIABILITY CAP: Except for liability under Section 9.0 ("Indemnification"), Supplier's liability for all claims, however caused and on any theory of liability arising out of this Agreement, shall in no event exceed an amount equal [*] of the total purchase revenue actually received by Buyer in respect of the affected Products in the [*] immediately preceding the event giving rise to such damages or [*], whichever is greater.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Supplier will: (i) ensure it and Supplier Personnel are in compliance with all laws, regulations, ordinances, and licensing requirements; (ii) be responsible for the supervision, control, compensation, withholdings, health and safety of Supplier Personnel; (iii) ensure Supplier Personnel performing Services on Buyer's premises comply with the On Premises Guidelines, which will be provided to Supplier; and (iv) to the best of Supplier's knowledge, inform Buyer if a former employee of Buyer will be assigned work under this Agreement, such assignment subject to Buyer approval.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
12.0 ELECTRONIC COMMERCE: The parties will use commercially reasonable efforts to establish procedures that would enable the parties to conduct transactions using an electronic commerce approach under which the parties will electronically transmit and receive legally binding purchase and sale obligations ("Documents"), including electronic credit entries transmitted by Buyer to the Supplier account specified in the relevant SOW.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Each party, at its own expense, will provide and maintain the equipment, software, services and testing necessary for it to effectively and reliably transmit and receive such Documents.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Either party may use a third party service provider for network services, provided the other party is given sixty (60) days prior written notice of any changes to such services.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
A Document will be deemed received upon arrival at the receiving party's mailbox or Internet address and the receiving party will promptly send an acknowledgment of receipt of such Document from the receiving party.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
The receiving party will promptly notify the originating party if a Document is received in an unintelligible form, provided that the originating * Certain information on this page has been omitted and filed separately with the Commission.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT party can be identified.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
In the absence of receiving party's acknowledgment of a given Document, the originating party will be obligated to resend the Document until such time as it receives an acknowledgment that the Document has been received by the receiving party as set forth above.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Each party will authenticate Documents using a digital signature or User ID mutually agreed by the parties, and will maintain security procedures to prevent its unauthorized use.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
13.0 RECORDKEEPING AND AUDIT RIGHTS: Supplier will maintain (and provide to Buyer upon reasonable notice and frequency to Supplier) relevant accounting records to support invoices under this Agreement for three (3) years following completion or termination of the relevant SOW.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
All accounting records will be maintained in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.2 ASSIGNMENT: Neither party will assign their rights or delegate or subcontract their duties under this Agreement to third parties or affiliates without the prior written consent of the other party, such consent not to be withheld unreasonably, except that Buyer may assign this Agreement in conjunction with the sale of a substantial part of its business utilizing this Agreement.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Unless otherwise provided by local law without the possibility of contractual waiver or limitation, any legal or other action related to this Agreement must be commenced no later than two (2) years from the date on which the claim of action arose.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
The parties expressly disclaim the applicability of the United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods (CISG).
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.4 COMMUNICATIONS: All communications between the parties regarding this Agreement will be conducted through the parties' representatives as specified in the relevant SOW.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Supplier will use reasonable efforts to participate in replenishment logistics programs presented by Buyer.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 14.5 COUNTERPARTS: This Agreement may be signed in one or more counterparts, each of which will be deemed to be an original and all of which when taken together will constitute the same agreement.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.6 EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION: Unless required otherwise by law, all information exchanged by the parties will be considered nonconfidential.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
If the parties require the exchange of confidential information, such exchange will be made under the Confidential Disclosure Agreement (CDA) #OEM99026 dated February 2, 1999 and any Supplements thereto which have been signed or which may be signed in the future.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
The parties will not publicize the terms or conditions of this Agreement in any advertising, marketing or promotional materials except as may be required by law, provided the party publicizing obtains any confidentiality treatment available.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
Supplier will use information regarding this Agreement only in the performance of this Agreement.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.8 FORCE MAJEURE: Neither party will be in default or liable for any delay or failure to comply with this Agreement due to any cause beyond the control of the affected party, excluding labor disputes, provided such party promptly notifies the other.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
In the event of any conflict in these documents, the order of precedence will be: (i) the quantity, delivery location and method of shipment of Products ordered under a WA; (ii) the relevant SOW; (iii) the relevant PA; (iv) this Agreement.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.11 SEVERABILITY: If any term in this Agreement is found by competent judicial authority to be unenforceable in any respect, the validity of the remainder of this Agreement will be unaffected, provided that such unenforceability does not materially affect the parties' rights under this Agreement.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
14.13 WAIVER: An effective waiver under this Agreement must be in writing signed by the party waiving its right.
Supplier shall provide Buyer written sales order acknowledgment within [*] of receipt.
A waiver by either party of any instance of the other party's noncompliance with any obligation or responsibility under this Agreement will not be deemed a waiver of subsequent instances.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
3.2 TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT: Either party may terminate this Agreement, without any cancellation charge, for a material breach of the Agreement by the other party or if the other party becomes insolvent or files or has filed against it a petition in bankruptcy ("Cause"), to the extent permitted by law.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Such termination will be effective at the end of a thirty (30) day written notice period if the Cause remains uncured.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Either party may terminate this Agreement without Cause when there are no outstanding SOWs.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
3.3 TERMINATION OF A SOW OR WA: Buyer may terminate a SOW with Cause effective immediately or without Cause on 60 days written notice.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's written direction, Supplier will immediately: (i) cease work; (ii) prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Products and Services; (iii) deliver to Buyer Products satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon Prices in the relevant SOW; and (iv) deliver upon request any work in process.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
In the event Buyer terminates without Cause, Buyer will compensate Supplier for the actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Supplier for work in process up to and including the date of termination, provided Supplier uses reasonable efforts to mitigate Buyer's liability under this SubSection by, among other actions, returning to its suppliers, selling to others, or otherwise using the canceled Products (including raw materials or works in process) and provided such expenses do not exceed the Prices.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 4.0 PRICING 4.1 PRICING: Supplier will provide Products and Services to Buyer for the Prices.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Except as may be set forth in a SOW, the Prices for Products and Services specified in the applicable SOW, and reflected in a WA, will be the only amount due to Supplier from Buyer.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
[*] Prices will at least be competitive with industry prices for like products and services and, if not, Supplier will use commercially reasonable efforts to adjust its Prices so that they are competitive.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
5.0 PAYMENTS AND ACCEPTANCE: Terms for payment will be specified in the relevant SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Payment of invoices will not be deemed acceptance of Products or Services, but rather such Products or Services will be subject to inspection, test and rejection by Buyer for a period as specified in the relevant SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Buyer may reject Products or Services that do not comply with the specifications and require prompt correction or replacement of such Products, as specified in the relevant SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
During the relevant warranty period, Buyer may reject entire lots of Products which do not meet quality levels as specified in the relevant SOW after such testing and evaluation, and such Products shall be returned to Supplier as set forth in Section 6.2 ("Warranty Redemption") below.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
6.0 WARRANTIES 6.1 ONGOING WARRANTIES: Supplier makes the following ongoing representations and warranties: (i) it has the right to enter into this Agreement and its performance of this Agreement will not violate the terms of any contract, obligation, law, regulation or ordinance to which it is or becomes subject; (ii) to the best of Supplier's knowledge, no claim, lien, or action exists or is threatened against Supplier that would interfere with Buyer's use or sale of the Products; (iii) Products are free from defects in design (except for written designs provided by Buyer unless such designs are based entirely on Supplier's specifications), material and workmanship and will conform to the warranties and specifications in this Agreement for the time period from the date of shipment as specified in the relevant SOW; (iv) Products are safe for any use consistent with and will comply with the warranties and specifications in this Agreement; (v) Products and Services are Year 2000 ready such that they are capable of correctly processing, providing, receiving and displaying date data, as well as exchanging accurate date data with all products with which the Products are intended to be used as set forth in the accompanying documentation, within and between the twentieth and twentyfirst centuries, provided that all other products (e.g., hardware, software and firmware) used in combination with the Products properly exchange date data with the * Certain information on this page has been omitted and filed separately with the Commission.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will promptly notify Buyer in writing should there be any failure to adhere to the representations and warranties as stated herein.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
THE WARRANTIES IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS AND CONDITIONS, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING THOSE WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OR CONDITIONS OF MERCHANTABILITY, NONINFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY RIGHTS OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR USE.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
6.2 WARRANTY REDEMPTION: If Products or Services do not comply with the warranties in this Agreement, Supplier will repair or replace Products (at the mutually agreed to level) or reperform Services, or credit or refund the thencurrent Price of Products or Services, such remedy at Supplier's discretion.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
For such Products, Supplier will issue to Buyer a Return Material Authorization ("RMA") within two (2) business days of Buyer's written notice.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Buyer may return Products which do not conform to the warranties in this Agreement from any Buyer location to the nearest authorized Supplier location at cost of Supplier and Supplier will, at cost of Supplier, return any repaired or replaced Product in a timely manner.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
6.3 POST WARRANTY SERVICE: Supplier will offer post warranty Services as specified in the relevant SOW or identify a third party which will provide such Services.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
In the event a third party will provide such Services, Supplier will provide the designated party with the information required for the performance of the Services.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
6.4 EPIDEMIC DEFECTS: Supplier will, at Buyer's discretion, repair or replace, or provide a credit or refund (at the thencurrent Prices) for Products which have the same or similar defect at a rate as specified in the relevant SOW ("Epidemic Defect Rate"), after verification of such Epidemic Defect Rate by Supplier, or where a safety defect is found.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will commence such performance within five (5) calendar days of Buyer's written notice to Supplier of an Epidemic Defect Rate.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will reimburse Buyer for all actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Buyer, as mutually agreed to, for such repair and replacement of Products, including expenses associated with problem diagnosis, field and finished goods inventory repair or replacement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
7.0 DELIVERY 7.1 DELIVERY LOGISTICS: Delivery under this Agreement means delivery to the Buyer location and/or Buyer delivery point as specified in the relevant SOW or WA.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Buyer may EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT cancel or reschedule the delivery date or change the delivery point as specified in the relevant SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
The term of sale will be specified in the relevant SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Buyer will use commercially reasonable efforts to issue a [*] rolling forecast for quantities of Products that may be required.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will only deliver the Products specified in a WA.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
ANY PRODUCT QUANTITIES CITED IN OR PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEMENT, EXCEPT FOR QUANTITIES CITED IN A WA, ARE PRELIMINARY AND NONBINDING ONLY.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
BUYER MAKES NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY AS TO THE QUANTITY OF PRODUCTS THAT IT WILL PURCHASE, IF ANY.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
7.2 ONTIME DELIVERY: The leadtime for Buyer to issue a WA prior to delivery will be specified in a SOW.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Except as provided in SubSection 14.8 ("Force Majeure"), Products specified in a WA for delivery with such leadtime will be delivered on time.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Supplier will use commercially reasonable efforts when Buyer requests delivery with a shorter leadtime.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
If Supplier cannot comply with a delivery commitment, Supplier will promptly notify Buyer of a revised delivery date and Buyer may: (i) cancel without charge any Products or Services ordered under a given WA which have not yet been Delivered; (ii) require Supplier to deliver Products using priority freight delivery at Supplier's expense for the incremental freight charges; and (iv) exercise all other remedies provided in this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
8.0 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY: Supplier grants Buyer all intellectual property rights licensable by Supplier which are necessary for Buyer to sell the Products from Supplier and to use the Products as expressly provided for under this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
8.1 MICROCODE LICENSE: Supplier hereby grants Buyer a nonexclusive, worldwide, right and license under all applicable intellectual property rights of Supplier to (i) use, execute and display all device drivers, firmware and software of Supplier used in the support and operation of the Products, including upgrades, updates, bug fixes or backup versions of the same (the "Microcode"), in object code format only, in conjunction with, or for use with the Products, (ii) reproduce, distribute and license the Microcode, in object code format only, as part of, in conjunction with or for use with the Products sold or leased by Buyer to end users, and (iii) to authorize, license and sublicense third parties to do any, some or all of the foregoing.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
Buyer shall distribute the Microcode (as incorporated into the Products) with an end user agreement which is legally enforceable in the jurisdiction within which the Products are distributed, and which is no less protective of Supplier's rights than this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 8.2 RESTRICTIONS: Buyer shall have no right to (i) sell the Microcode in standalone form; (ii) modify or adapt the Microcode for other products or create derivative works of the Microcode; (iii) decompile, reverse translate, or disassemble the Microcode for any reason, or (iv) use or distribute the Microcode for any purpose other than as set forth in this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
8.3 TRADEMARKS: This Agreement does not grant either party the right to use the other party's trademarks, trade names or service marks.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
8.4 OWNERSHIP: Notwithstanding the terms of SubSection 14.10 ("Prior Communication and Order of Preference"), nothing in this Agreement or any SOW or WA shall be construed to grant any title or rights of ownership of the Microcode to Buyer, and that Supplier owns and shall continue to own all right, title and interest in the Microcode.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.

If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.

If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
If such a claim is or is likely to be made, Supplier will, at its option: (i) obtain for Buyer the right to continue to use and sell the Products and Services consistent with this Agreement; (ii) modify the Products and Services so they are noninfringing and in compliance with this Agreement; or (iii) replace the Products and Services with noninfringing ones that comply with this Agreement.
If order acknowledgment is not received with [*], the WA will be deemed to be accepted by Supplier.
In the event that none of the options in the preceding sentence are commercially practical, at Buyer's request, Supplier shall accept the cancellation of infringing Services and/or the return of infringing Products, and refund to Buyer the amounts paid in respect of such infringing Services and/or infringing Products.

A waiver by either party of any instance of the other party's noncompliance with any obligation or responsibility under this Agreement will not be deemed a waiver of subsequent instances.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

3.2 TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT: Either party may terminate this Agreement, without any cancellation charge, for a material breach of the Agreement by the other party or if the other party becomes insolvent or files or has filed against it a petition in bankruptcy ("Cause"), to the extent permitted by law.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
Such termination will be effective at the end of a thirty (30) day written notice period if the Cause remains uncured.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
Either party may terminate this Agreement without Cause when there are no outstanding SOWs.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
3.3 TERMINATION OF A SOW OR WA: Buyer may terminate a SOW with Cause effective immediately or without Cause on 60 days written notice.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's written direction, Supplier will immediately: (i) cease work; (ii) prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Products and Services; (iii) deliver to Buyer Products satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon Prices in the relevant SOW; and (iv) deliver upon request any work in process.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.
In the event Buyer terminates without Cause, Buyer will compensate Supplier for the actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Supplier for work in process up to and including the date of termination, provided Supplier uses reasonable efforts to mitigate Buyer's liability under this SubSection by, among other actions, returning to its suppliers, selling to others, or otherwise using the canceled Products (including raw materials or works in process) and provided such expenses do not exceed the Prices.
3.0 TERM AND TERMINATION 3.1 TERM: Products and Services acquired by Buyer on or after the Effective Date will be covered by this Agreement.

During the relevant warranty period, Buyer may reject entire lots of Products which do not meet quality levels as specified in the relevant SOW after such testing and evaluation, and such Products shall be returned to Supplier as set forth in Section 6.2 ("Warranty Redemption") below.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
6.0 WARRANTIES 6.1 ONGOING WARRANTIES: Supplier makes the following ongoing representations and warranties: (i) it has the right to enter into this Agreement and its performance of this Agreement will not violate the terms of any contract, obligation, law, regulation or ordinance to which it is or becomes subject; (ii) to the best of Supplier's knowledge, no claim, lien, or action exists or is threatened against Supplier that would interfere with Buyer's use or sale of the Products; (iii) Products are free from defects in design (except for written designs provided by Buyer unless such designs are based entirely on Supplier's specifications), material and workmanship and will conform to the warranties and specifications in this Agreement for the time period from the date of shipment as specified in the relevant SOW; (iv) Products are safe for any use consistent with and will comply with the warranties and specifications in this Agreement; (v) Products and Services are Year 2000 ready such that they are capable of correctly processing, providing, receiving and displaying date data, as well as exchanging accurate date data with all products with which the Products are intended to be used as set forth in the accompanying documentation, within and between the twentieth and twentyfirst centuries, provided that all other products (e.g., hardware, software and firmware) used in combination with the Products properly exchange date data with the * Certain information on this page has been omitted and filed separately with the Commission.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will promptly notify Buyer in writing should there be any failure to adhere to the representations and warranties as stated herein.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
THE WARRANTIES IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS AND CONDITIONS, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING THOSE WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OR CONDITIONS OF MERCHANTABILITY, NONINFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY RIGHTS OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR USE.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
6.2 WARRANTY REDEMPTION: If Products or Services do not comply with the warranties in this Agreement, Supplier will repair or replace Products (at the mutually agreed to level) or reperform Services, or credit or refund the thencurrent Price of Products or Services, such remedy at Supplier's discretion.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
For such Products, Supplier will issue to Buyer a Return Material Authorization ("RMA") within two (2) business days of Buyer's written notice.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Buyer may return Products which do not conform to the warranties in this Agreement from any Buyer location to the nearest authorized Supplier location at cost of Supplier and Supplier will, at cost of Supplier, return any repaired or replaced Product in a timely manner.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
6.3 POST WARRANTY SERVICE: Supplier will offer post warranty Services as specified in the relevant SOW or identify a third party which will provide such Services.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
In the event a third party will provide such Services, Supplier will provide the designated party with the information required for the performance of the Services.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
6.4 EPIDEMIC DEFECTS: Supplier will, at Buyer's discretion, repair or replace, or provide a credit or refund (at the thencurrent Prices) for Products which have the same or similar defect at a rate as specified in the relevant SOW ("Epidemic Defect Rate"), after verification of such Epidemic Defect Rate by Supplier, or where a safety defect is found.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will commence such performance within five (5) calendar days of Buyer's written notice to Supplier of an Epidemic Defect Rate.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will reimburse Buyer for all actual and reasonable expenses incurred by Buyer, as mutually agreed to, for such repair and replacement of Products, including expenses associated with problem diagnosis, field and finished goods inventory repair or replacement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
The term of sale will be specified in the relevant SOW.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will only deliver the Products specified in a WA.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
BUYER MAKES NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY AS TO THE QUANTITY OF PRODUCTS THAT IT WILL PURCHASE, IF ANY.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will use commercially reasonable efforts when Buyer requests delivery with a shorter leadtime.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
If Supplier cannot comply with a delivery commitment, Supplier will promptly notify Buyer of a revised delivery date and Buyer may: (i) cancel without charge any Products or Services ordered under a given WA which have not yet been Delivered; (ii) require Supplier to deliver Products using priority freight delivery at Supplier's expense for the incremental freight charges; and (iv) exercise all other remedies provided in this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
8.0 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY: Supplier grants Buyer all intellectual property rights licensable by Supplier which are necessary for Buyer to sell the Products from Supplier and to use the Products as expressly provided for under this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
8.1 MICROCODE LICENSE: Supplier hereby grants Buyer a nonexclusive, worldwide, right and license under all applicable intellectual property rights of Supplier to (i) use, execute and display all device drivers, firmware and software of Supplier used in the support and operation of the Products, including upgrades, updates, bug fixes or backup versions of the same (the "Microcode"), in object code format only, in conjunction with, or for use with the Products, (ii) reproduce, distribute and license the Microcode, in object code format only, as part of, in conjunction with or for use with the Products sold or leased by Buyer to end users, and (iii) to authorize, license and sublicense third parties to do any, some or all of the foregoing.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Buyer shall distribute the Microcode (as incorporated into the Products) with an end user agreement which is legally enforceable in the jurisdiction within which the Products are distributed, and which is no less protective of Supplier's rights than this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 8.2 RESTRICTIONS: Buyer shall have no right to (i) sell the Microcode in standalone form; (ii) modify or adapt the Microcode for other products or create derivative works of the Microcode; (iii) decompile, reverse translate, or disassemble the Microcode for any reason, or (iv) use or distribute the Microcode for any purpose other than as set forth in this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
8.3 TRADEMARKS: This Agreement does not grant either party the right to use the other party's trademarks, trade names or service marks.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
8.4 OWNERSHIP: Notwithstanding the terms of SubSection 14.10 ("Prior Communication and Order of Preference"), nothing in this Agreement or any SOW or WA shall be construed to grant any title or rights of ownership of the Microcode to Buyer, and that Supplier owns and shall continue to own all right, title and interest in the Microcode.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
9.0 INDEMNIFICATION 9.1 GENERAL INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will defend, hold harmless and indemnify, including attorney's fees, Buyer and Buyer Personnel against claims that arise or are alleged to have arisen as a result of negligent or intentional acts or omissions of Supplier or Supplier Personnel in performing its obligations under this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
9.2 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will defend, hold harmless and indemnify, including attorney's fees, Buyer and Buyer Personnel from claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
If such a claim is or is likely to be made, Supplier will, at its option: (i) obtain for Buyer the right to continue to use and sell the Products and Services consistent with this Agreement; (ii) modify the Products and Services so they are noninfringing and in compliance with this Agreement; or (iii) replace the Products and Services with noninfringing ones that comply with this Agreement.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
In the event that none of the options in the preceding sentence are commercially practical, at Buyer's request, Supplier shall accept the cancellation of infringing Services and/or the return of infringing Products, and refund to Buyer the amounts paid in respect of such infringing Services and/or infringing Products.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
9.3 EXCEPTIONS TO INDEMNIFICATION: Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for claims that Supplier's Products or Services infringe the intellectual property rights of a third party to the extent such claims arise as a result of: (i) Buyer's combination of Products or Services with products or services not authorized by Supplier or approved for use with the Products; (ii) Supplier's implementation of a Buyer originated design; or (iii) Buyer's unauthorized modification of the Products.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will have no obligation to indemnify Buyer or Buyer Personnel for any claim under this Section 9 unless Buyer has promptly notified Supplier of such claim, has provided Supplier with reasonable assistance in defending any such claim and has allowed Supplier to have sole control over the defense and settlement, if applicable, of any such claim.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer shall have the right, at Buyer's expense, to retain counsel and assist in the defense of any such claim.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
EXHIBIT 10.24 GOODS AGREEMENT 10.0 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY: 10.1 LIMITATION: Except for liability under the Section entitled Indemnification and the SubSection entitled Epidemic Defects, in no event will either party be liable to the other for any lost revenues, lost profits, incidental, indirect, consequential, special or punitive damages, whether or not such party was informed of the possibility of such damages.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Supplier will: (i) ensure it and Supplier Personnel are in compliance with all laws, regulations, ordinances, and licensing requirements; (ii) be responsible for the supervision, control, compensation, withholdings, health and safety of Supplier Personnel; (iii) ensure Supplier Personnel performing Services on Buyer's premises comply with the On Premises Guidelines, which will be provided to Supplier; and (iv) to the best of Supplier's knowledge, inform Buyer if a former employee of Buyer will be assigned work under this Agreement, such assignment subject to Buyer approval.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
Each party will authenticate Documents using a digital signature or User ID mutually agreed by the parties, and will maintain security procedures to prevent its unauthorized use.
This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.

This Agreement will remain in effect until terminated.
